item.title: Lea. add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Humor is the spiciest condiment in the feast of existence. Laugh at your mistakes but learn from them, joke over your troubles but gather strength from them, make a jest of your difficulties but overcome them." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Lea. add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lea. add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can make anything by writing." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lea. add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Adriana Trigiani
item.description: "I even love the smell of books." -- Adriana Trigiani

item.title: Lea. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Lea. add a quote by John Green
item.description: "My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations." -- John Green

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "For the two of us, home isn't a place. It is a person. And we are finally home." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?" -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description:
"He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.
She was the book thief without the words.
Trust me, though, the words were on their way, and when they arrived, Liesel would hold them in her hands like the clouds, and she would wring them out like rain." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Touchstone watched, suddenly conscious that he probably only had five seconds left to be alone with Sabriel, to say something, to say anything. Perhaps the last five seconds they ever would have alone together. I am not afraid, he said to himself. "I love you," he whispered. "I hope you don't mind." -- Garth Nix

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Lea. add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "There's always room for a story that can transport people to another place." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Stories, like people and butterflies and songbirds' eggs and human hearts and dreams, are also fragile things, made up of nothing stronger or more lasting than twenty-six letters and a handful of punctuation marks. Or they are words on the air, composed of sounds and ideas-abstract, invisible, gone once they've been spoken-and what could be more frail than that? But some stories, small, simple ones about setting out on adventures or people doing wonders, tales of miracles and monsters, have outlasted all the people who told them, and some of them have outlasted the lands in which they were created." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "We owe it to each other to tell stories." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Stories make us more alive, more human, more courageous, more loving." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Lea. add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "I only know one story. But oftentimes small pieces seem to be stories themselves." -- Patrick Rothfuss
